intro: Cymbocarpum alinihatii, commonly known as the desert cactus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh desert conditions through its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its flowers typically bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The fruit produced by Cymbocarpum alinihatii is a hard, woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
